homeDate: Every Saturday (May through October) from 9:00 am until noon.
aboutUsBodyStarting: The Midland Community Farmers Market is operated as a non-profit function of the Mens' Club of Midland United Methodist Church, and is offered as a service to the people of the Midland area of Georgia's Muscogee and Harris Counties. All vendor fees go to support the club's local outreach ministries, including
aboutUsBodyEnding: . Come on out and have a good time while supporting your community. SEE YOU THERE!

bringYourStuff.item1SubText: Organic Vegetables, Farm-fresh Eggs, and Goat Dairy Items.
bringYourStuff.item2SubText: Homemade Pickles, Jams and Jellies, Local Honey, and Delicious Baked Goods.
bringYourStuff.item3SubText: Fine Handicrafts, Handmade Candles and Soaps
bringYourStuff.item4SubText: Flowers, Bonsai, and So Much More...

contact.contactAddressSub: (the corner of Warm Springs and Garrett Roads)
contact.contactFromColumbus: Head east on Manchester Expressway (north GA-85 / US-27 Alt.) Take the County Line Road exit, and turn left across the bridge. Go a quarter mile and turn right onto Garrett Road.
contact.contactFromWarmSprings: Head south on GA-85. Go four miles past Ellerslie, turn right at the County Line Road exit, and right again at Garrett Road.

springFling.infoSection1: As always, the weekly market season will open on the first Saturday in May. But for those who just can't wait, in March we'll repeat last year's very popular pre-season event: the second annual
springFling.infoSection2: It might still be a little early then for some of the veggies, but all your favorite vendors from the
springFling.infoSection3: will be on hand, with arts and crafts, fine woodworking, fabric items, baked goods, pickles, jams, jellies, and much, much more! No reservation required. Vendor fees* will be $15, which will go to local charities.
springFling.comment: (*As always, charitable groups and kids under 13 are free.)
springFling.whenIsIt: Mark your calendars for Saturday, March 14th, from 11:00 - 3:00.
